unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Vendor Audits Tightened Ahead of Festive Season**
normalised: **Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Vendor Audits Tightened Ahead of Festive Season**

unnormalised: Mumbai, October 26 – Leading manufacturers are ramping up vendor audits across their supply chains in anticipation of increased demand during the upcoming Diwali and Chhath Puja season. Concerns over quality control and ethical sourcing are driving the intensified scrutiny.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six – Leading manufacturers are ramping up vendor audits across their supply chains in anticipation of increased demand during the upcoming Diwali and Chhath Puja season. Concerns over quality control and ethical sourcing are driving the intensified scrutiny.

unnormalised: “We’re seeing a 25% increase in audit requests, particularly in textiles and electronics components,” says Mr. Sharma, Head of Compliance at the Federation of Indian Industries (FII). Audits are focusing on adherence to labour laws, environmental regulations, and material quality.
normalised: “We are seeing a twenty five percent increase in audit requests, particularly in textiles and electronics components,” says Mister Sharma, Head of Compliance at the Federation of Indian Industries (F I I). Audits are focusing on adherence to labor laws, environmental regulations, and material quality.

unnormalised: One Chennai-based automotive component manufacturer, Ashok Leyland, reports uncovering several instances of non-compliance, leading to contract termination with three vendors. "We cannot compromise on quality, especially with customers expecting world-class products during the festive rush," stated a company spokesperson. Expect more rigorous checks, including surprise inspections, and enhanced documentation reviews. Vendors are also encouraged to proactively offer employees festive bonuses (Rs. 5000 minimum) to boost morale and productivity. Ensuring production lines are smooth as biryani served during an Onam sadhya is vital.
